data.title: Updated Swift Autocompletion Syntax
data.body:
Performed updates to the Swift Snippets JSON so that they match the latest language syntax

Updated :
- print()
- repeat {} while

Added :
- Guard statement
- Optional Binding Statement

data.title: RSS feed for code.visualstudio.com
data.body:
You recently moved to VS Code blog to code.visualstudio.com, but in the move, RSS feed support was lost.

I'd like to request RSS feed for the blog (https://code.visualstudio.com/blogs) and updates (https://code.visualstudio.com/Updates).

Thanks

data.title: Improve hover appearance
data.body:
I find it difficult to read hovers: the font is the same as the underlying text and the hover text does not stand out from the underlying text. And the fixed width font makes hovers wider than necessary. 

Look here: where is the hover?
![2016-02-20 14-33-36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/13196972/746a61bc-d7df-11e5-883a-1a926573f05b.png)

data.title: Enable Extension Tips by default
data.body:
Extension tips are currently disabled by default. 

``` json
"extensions.showTips": false
```

@waderyan has tested them and gave positive feedback so we should enable this feature by default.

data.title: Meteor dev: A lot of undefined variables highlighted in VSCode
data.body: Hi, first of all: Thanks for VSCode and open sourcing it. It's on a good road to becoming my favourite editor and also introduced me to TypeScript, which is really awesome, too! When developing for Meteor with VSCode it often appears that there are some undefined variables, like `Template` or `Meteor`. Of course these variables are not defined in the one of the many files in my project, since they are part of the framework themselves. I already downloaded the `.d.ts` files from http://definitelytyped.org - and VSCode already recognises them. I.e. it gives hints for function params and I can go to the definition of the variable when CMD-clicking the variable. As can be seen in the the screenshot this (of course) also appears to packages that have been installed via `meteor add` (here it's the i18n package). Just to be clear: In meteor it's not an issue, since all files get automatically bundled in meteors automatic build process.

data.title: Documentation of installer tasks
data.body:
I would like to enhance the existing Chocolatey package for Visual Studio Code with the parameters already available in the installer (for context menu, icon, etc, see https://github.com/iozag/chocolatey-packages/issues/18). Is the source code of the setup somewhere available? Or is there any documentation about the available installer tasks?

I now about `runcode`, `desktopicon`, `quicklaunchicon`. Whats the name of the other tasks?

data.title: Custom menu entires, context menu entries, and action bar items
data.body:
I'd like to add a context menu item that performs a Google search using the current selection.

However, there doesn't seem to be a way to bind to the right click or to an open context menu event.

I see several requests for features to add to the context menu... wouldn't it be easier if VS Code just made it possible for extensions to register a context menu entry?

data.title: Open file opens in a new vscode instance
data.body:
When we open a file from the OS, it should open in the existing instance of vscode. 

As of now it opens in a totally new instance.

data.title: The new blog should provide the rss feed
data.body:
## Problem

https://code.visualstudio.com/blogs has not provided the rss feed yet.
## Expected Result

I'd like to subscribe this new blog via feed reader like feedly.
Could you provide the rss feed?

data.title: CMD+` does not switch through open vs.code windows
data.body: Also, there is no actual way to switch between different vscode windows on mac.

data.title: Extract The Code Editor
data.body: The actual code editor should be extracted and made into its own separate project outside of VSCode itself. The editor would be massively useful in a variety of other projects that need to embed an editor and many could benefit from this separation. It would also provide a nice 3rd alternative to the other two well-established editors of Ace and CodeMirror.

data.title: Error navigation does not work

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
On the bottom of the page where the error count appears, when I click on the error count, it shows me the list of errors.

When I click on them, it used to take me to the error but instead, now it's asking me to create a new file. The new file name has [0] and the original file in error.

Am I doing something wrong or this is actually a bug?

data.title: "Accessibility Tab Mode" background and text pure white on hc-dark theme
data.body: We need to address the dialogue for how to use the "Accessibility Tab Mode."  It's pure white currently on hc-dark theme.  Should be a simple fix.

data.title: Enabling high contrast dark theme on all platforms + hc-dark improvements
data.body:
Addresses #2711
- Enables the hc-dark theme on all platforms.
- Improves color contrast to AAA standard on many elements that weren't previously meeting it.
- Resolves visual bugs, such as synthetic-focus misplacement and action bar duplicate icons
- Differentiates the selection of text from current line and find/word matching
- Works well in Mac OSX even when OS-level accessibility features are enabled, such as increasing contrast.
### NOTE:

A CSS rule used (`mix-blend-mode: difference;`) currently works in all browsers but Opera, IE and Edge, so it will not be ideal for the online Monaco editor without suitable shims.  Let me know if we need to address this; we can do that now or in the future.

data.title: Add diff language mode for .diff and .patch files
Telemetry opt-out
data.body:
- [x] windows @alexandrudima 
- [x] mac @weinand 
- [x] linux @aeschli 

Users now have the option to opt out of telemetry. To toggle telemetry open user settings and change `telemetry.enableTelemetry`

To test:
- Open the dev tools and set a breakpoint at application insight channel.js#79
- Do some work in the product 
- make sure data flows fine by inspecting batch object.
- disable telemetry & reload the window.
- verify that only event is reported 'optout'.
- without reloading the window, enable telemetry back and verify that breakpoint is hit and data is reported.

data.title: Telemetry application insights refactor
data.body:
- [x] windows @joaomoreno
- [x] mac @weinand 
- [x] linux @Tyriar 

The application insights adapter has been refactored, that code path is critical as it affects all the telemetry data flowing from VSCode. 

To test:
1. Open the Chrome Dev Tools within Code and set a breakpoint in `...\resources\app\node_modules\applicationinsights\Library\Channel.js`.
2. Do some work in the product 
3. Once the breakpoint is hit, inspect the `batch` variable by running `batch.split('\n').map(JSON.parse)` in the console.
4. Verify that:
   1. all events' `data.baseData.name` is prefixed with `monacoworkbench/`
   2. numeric values are under `measurements`
   3. textual values are under `properties`

data.title: VS Code through Windows Explorer integration doesn't function if there is another instance of VS Code already open
data.body:
If you already have VS Code open (either with an open folder/file or an empty window), if you try to open up a **second** instance of VS Code by right-clicking on a file/folder in Windows Explorer and click _Open with Code_, nothing happens.  The desired functionality would be for opening files/folders through Windows Explorer integration to function even if there are already opened instances of VS Code.
### Repro Steps
1. Open up VS Code (doesn't matter if you open up VS Code with no file or folder, the behavior is the same)
2. In Windows Explorer, navigate to a folder with a flat file
3. Right-click on the file and select _Open with Code_
4. Note that this attempt at opening a 2nd instance of VS Code through Windows Explorer doesn't succeed

data.title: New extension tips for php, ts, py, cc, rs
Add support for peeking to file found a relative path of current string
mkdir by nodejs module doesn't work in mac - Extension
Occasional code mangling with tab on blocks of highlighted code
data.body:
I haven't found a way to deterministically repeat this, but when I highlight several lines of code and hit tab, sometimes it mangles the code (hitting ctrl+z only further mangles the code), unless I copy the code first, I can't go backwards.

My settings.json only has the following
`"editor.renderWhitespace": true,
    "editor.insertSpaces": true`

EDIT: this is running Version 0.10.8 db71ac615ddf9f33b133ff2536f5d33a77d4774e

data.title: Taskbar icon's white borders

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: After January update, VS Code's icons smaller than 128x128 have its borders pixelated, probably because when its size goes down, the borders start losing smoothness and become very sharp, leaving a visually unpleasant effect.

data.title: Code reports errors in removed source files
data.body:
![removedfiles](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9561583/13184519/42ae62d4-d6f1-11e5-8b4b-0668f44d7e4a.gif)

On my OS X Yosemite machine running Code, I was adding/removing code in a solution.  One of the files I removed had a C# build error.  The interesting thing was the the error persisted in my Code session even after deleting the file (control - click - delete).  The error only went away once I closed the folder and reopened.

data.title: C# parameter hints does not dismiss after newline
data.body:
![csharp intellisense](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9561583/13184238/852514b6-d6ef-11e5-9a05-8dd241d8d41b.gif)

To dismiss an intellisense suggestion, you should be able to hit <esc> (that works) or complete the line (;<newline>).  On OS X Yosemite the suggestion does not dismiss once I hit return and will stay there as I type a new line of code.

data.title: There is no shortcut for toggling the menu bar
data.body: I inadvertently hid the menu bar and then spent 30 minutes trying to figure out how to get it back, only to find there is no shortcut (that I can find) to permanently toggle it. So you have to use the ALT key to toggle it back on temporarily (found that in online help) and then use the menu itself to toggle it back on permanently. Unless I'm missing something. Editing the boolean in a config file (storage.json) also does not change the setting permanently. Thanks.

data.title: [debt] Actions should be allowed to be created with no service dependency
data.body:
Currently it is not possible to create an action that has no service dependency, so we have to create a fake service dependecy to `NullService`.

Could this be solved by removing our old injection way. I think this is something we should tackle in a debt week.

data.title: Test Salsa as the default JS infrastructure
data.body:
Only the opening of the release notes in the browser needs to be tested across platforms
- [x] Win @alexandrudima  
- [x] OS X @chrisdias 
- [x] Linux @aeschli  _I confess... I didn't get to test the opening of the browser on Linux_

Salsa is now the default JS infrastructure. 
- you get an info message that Salsa is now the default when you open a .js file for the first time. The message provides you with the option to read the change notes/migration guide. Verify that this message is only shown once (the state is stored in (`storage://global/vscode.javascript-migration`).
- follow migrating to Salsa guide to setup your JavaScript project to enable warnings etc.
- use an Ember project setup to test Salsa. The old JavaScript service excluded several directories by default (e.g. tmp) which Salsa doesn't do. Verify the experience and in particular that Code doesn't crash.

```
npm install -g ember-cli
npm install -g bower
npm install -g ember-cli-windows

ember-cli-windows    (you may need to Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -scope CurrentUser for this to execute)
npm install
bower install
ember serve

Then browse at localhost:4200 to run server.
```
